intro: Caloncoba longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled caloncoba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated petioles. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
